title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional review of newly-passed District laws. Section 602 and section 604 are struck, and the exercise of rulemaking power is clarified. The subsection and its amendments are enacted by Congress as an exercise of rulemaking power, recognizing the constitutional implications. The subsection and its amendments enacted by Congress as an exercise of rulemaking power, recognizing the constitutional implications. Rules specifically apply and supersede inconsistent rules, with recognition of the constitutional right of each House to change rules at any time. The text chunk "SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS." is a concise statement regarding conforming amendments without providing specific details. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove certain subsections and sentences, as well as to adjust references in specific sections. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by removing subsections and sentences in specific sections, such as Section 462, 472(d), and 475(e). The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to exclude certain payments related to revenue anticipation notes. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to exclude certain payments related to revenue anticipation notes. Section 2(b)(1) and Section 5 of Amendment No. 1 to the District Charter are also amended. Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 is modified. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to exclude certain payments related to revenue anticipation notes. Section 2(b)(1) and Section 5 of Amendment No. 1 to the District Charter are also amended. Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 is modified by striking certain sections and sentences. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to exclude certain payments related to revenue anticipation notes. Amendments are made to Section 2(b)(1) and Section 5 of Amendment No. 1 to the District Charter. Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 is modified by striking certain sections and sentences. In subsection (m), changes are made to remove specific language and insert new wording. The amendments made by this Act apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed on or after October 1, 2002, including those signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed by the Council, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors.
